body_html:
Here is a very approximate implementation. It seems to be not reliable. The main problem is that we can't securely infer input and output of recurrent nets. For example whether a hidden state is considered as output?
One workaround is to add to every module some attributes that would contain information about inputs and outputs. This will make automatic stacking of modules very simple. How about such a feature?

body:
[Here](https://github.com/vlasenkov/pytorch/blob/seq-rnn/torch/nn/modules/container.py#L67-L84) is a very approximate implementation. It seems to be not reliable. The main problem is that we can't securely infer input and output of recurrent nets. For example whether a hidden state is considered as output?
One workaround is to add to every module some attributes that would contain information about inputs and outputs. This will make automatic stacking of modules very simple. How about such a feature?
